input: Anne is kind. Anne is nice. Charlie is kind. Charlie is quiet. Charlie is red. Erin is furry. Erin is quiet. Erin is red. Harry is kind. Harry is nice. Harry is quiet. All cold, nice people are furry. If Harry is quiet then Harry is furry. Red, cold people are big. If someone is kind then they are quiet. All kind, nice people are quiet. All furry, cold people are red. If Anne is quiet and Anne is kind then Anne is cold. Question: Anne is not big.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Quiet : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Cold : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Kind Anne
axiom T2 : Nice Anne
axiom T3 : Kind Charlie
axiom T4 : Quiet Charlie
axiom T5 : Red Charlie
axiom T6 : Furry Erin
axiom T7 : Quiet Erin
axiom T8 : Red Erin
axiom T9 : Kind Harry
axiom T10 : Nice Harry
axiom T11 : Quiet Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x ∧ Nice x → Furry x
axiom R2 : Quiet Harry → Furry Harry
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Red x ∧ Cold x → Big x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x → Quiet x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ Nice x → Quiet x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ Cold x → Red x
axiom R7 : Quiet Anne ∧ Kind Anne → Cold Anne

theorem anne_is_not_big : ¬ Big Anne :=
begin
  intro H,
  apply R3 Anne in H,
  cases H with H1 H2,
  apply R6 Anne in H1,
  cases H1 with H3 H4,
  apply R7 in H4,
  exact T1,
  exact R4 Anne T1,
  apply R1 Anne in H4,
  cases H4 with H5 H6,
  exact T2,
  contradiction,
end

-- The answer is True
